article:
'T5 bacteriophage' [http://www.uniprot.org/taxonomy/10726 Enterobacteria
phage T5] is a caudal virus who belongs to siphoviridae family. It's a
lytic phage that infect [[Escherichia coli|E. coli]]. T5 consists of a
90 nm large icosahedral capsid containing a 121750 bp dsDNA and a
250 nm long flexible and non contractile tail. Effantin G. et al.
Bacteriophage T5 structure reveals similarities with HK97 and T4 suggesting
evolutionary relationships. J Mol Biol. (2006) 361, 993-1002
